text: Yappity-yap~ It's Francis!
There are quite a number of menus that are named after foreign places, right?
Hand-rolled sushi of the origin in America, California roll.
Swiss roll is a standard sweet that is also popular in Japan.
If there are popular menus that have names of places which are eaten in your country, write in the Comments section, OK?
In Japan, everyone loves Spaghetti Napolitan, which has the name, Napoli!
To let you know how much this spaghetti is loved in Japan, I am already on my way.
I am now at Hotel New Grand, in Yokohama.
This is considered to be the birthplace of Napolitan!
It still is, even now!
You can enjoy Napolitan at coffee house, The Cafe, on the first floor.
Look, I am all dressed up. ‚ù§
I came to see Ms. Wada!
Let's waste no time, and try Napolitan.
I heard that Napolitan originated here at Hotel New Grand!
This Napolitan uses tomato sauce, and not ketchup!
I am amazed to hear the secret behind the chewiness of the spaghetti!
The balance of the sauce, spaghetti, and the ingredients is simply the best!
It certainly is a great name!
You can enjoy other menus that originated here at the Hotel New Grand at coffee house, The Cafe, besides Napolitan!
Ms. Officer... Sounds cool!
I was behaving well today, but my mouth usually gets all red with ketchup.
Next, I will introduce Napolitan that uses ketchup!
I am visiting Nippon Naporitan Gakkai that is working hard to reevaluate Napolitan that originated in Yokohama.
I am now at Shairly Cafe to learn how to cook Napolitan using ketchup!
Napolitan is a special menu that's served every Friday; it's really popular!
What is Nippon Naporitan Gakkai?
I will talk to- [stomach growling] Ohh, dear...
Great~!
